intro: Hieracium macrocarpum, commonly known as the large-fruited hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in sticky, glandular hairs. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture with serrated edges. The showy yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer, followed by large, hairy, yellowish-brown achenes that are dispersed by wind.
